unnormalised: Traveling within India often involves navigating the complex yet efficient network of Indian Airways. Understanding the nuances of booking, baggage allowance, and onboard services can significantly enhance your travel experience. This article aims to provide a comprehensive guide to help you fly smoothly with Indian carriers. Many major airlines, like Indigo (6E), SpiceJet (SG), and Air India (AI) operate numerous domestic routes daily, making air travel a convenient option for covering long distances.

unnormalised: Booking flights usually starts online. Most airlines have user-friendly websites or mobile apps. You can easily compare fares, check flight schedules, and book tickets. Watch out for promotional offers; for example, SpiceJet once offered tickets at Rs. 999 during a flash sale. Remember to book in advance, especially during peak seasons like Diwali or summer vacations, to secure better deals. Popular routes like Delhi to Mumbai (DEL-BOM) or Bangalore to Kolkata (BLR-CCU) get booked up quickly. Also, keep an eye out for "prepone" options in case your plans change.

unnormalised: Baggage allowance is another crucial aspect. Typically, the check-in baggage allowance is around 15 kg for economy class on most domestic flights. Cabin baggage is usually limited to 7 kg. Excess baggage charges can be quite steep, often ranging from Rs. 300 to Rs. 500 per kg. It's wise to weigh your bags before heading to the airport to avoid surprises at the check-in counter. Some airlines, like Air India (AI), offer slightly more generous baggage allowances for certain fare classes.

unnormalised: Onboard services vary depending on the airline and the flight duration. Short-haul flights usually offer a limited selection of snacks and beverages for purchase. Longer flights, particularly those operated by Air India, often include complimentary meals. Many airlines now offer inflight entertainment via personal devices; ensure you download the airline's app beforehand. Don't forget to carry your preferred reading material or download e-books to keep yourself entertained during the journey.

unnormalised: Airport security is a standard procedure. Arrive at least 2 hours before your scheduled departure for domestic flights. Keep your boarding pass and a valid photo ID (Aadhaar card, PAN card, or passport) readily available. Security checks can be time-consuming, especially during peak hours. Electronic devices, like laptops and tablets, need to be removed from your bag and placed in separate trays. Follow the instructions provided by the security personnel to expedite the process.

unnormalised: Finally, remember to check your flight status before heading to the airport. Flight delays and cancellations are not uncommon, especially during the monsoon season. Airlines usually send notifications via SMS or email, but it's always a good idea to verify the status on the airline's website or app. PNR number is essential to check the flight status. Most Indian airlines strive to provide a comfortable and reliable travel experience. By being well-informed and prepared, you can ensure a hassle-free journey across the diverse landscapes of India.
